intro: Canarium nitens, commonly known as the white nutmeg tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical fruits that contain a single seed. Its most notable feature is the aromatic, reddish-brown seed kernel, which is used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Canarium nitens thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
